titles: A C[hristian] and [plain]e treatise of the manner and order of predestination and of the largenes of Gods grace. First written in Latine by that reuerend and faithfull seruant of God, Master William Perkins, late preacher of the word in Cambridge. And carefully translated into English by Francis Cacot, and Thomas Tuke.
De prædestinationis modo et ordine. English
author: Perkins, William, 1558-1602.
Cacot, Francis.
Tuke, Thomas, d. 1657.
publisher: Printed [by F. Kingston] for William Welby and Martin Clarke,
notes: Title and printer's name from STC.
A translation, by Francis Cacot and Thomas Tuke, of: Perkins, William.  De prædestinationis modo et ordine, published in 1598.
Copy filmed has stained title page, with obliteration of some print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Christian ethics --  England --  Early works to 1800.
